\/.title: Home
\/.teaser_markdown: Tours of the VOA radio and television studios in Washington are available to the public. It's a fascinating look at the largest U.S. international broadcast operation.
\/.teaser_html: Tours of the VOA radio and television studios in Washington are available to the public. It's a fascinating look at the largest U.S. international broadcast operation.

content.markdown: The Voice of America Studio Tour is a behind-the-scenes look at live broadcasting in radio, television, and the Internet in several of our 45 languages. Tours last 45 minutes.
content.html: The Voice of America Studio Tour is a behind-the-scenes look at live broadcasting in radio, television, and the Internet in several of our 45 languages. Tours last 45 minutes.

content.markdown: You will need to present a valid US federal or state-issued picture ID, such as a driver's license, passport or state-issued ID. A non-US citizen is required to provide their passport. The building guards cannot accept other documents or waive these requirements.
content.html: You will need to present a valid US federal or state-issued picture ID, such as a driver's license, passport or state-issued ID. A non-US citizen is required to provide their passport. The building guards cannot accept other documents or waive these requirements.

content.markdown: VOA is located at 330 Independence Avenue, S.W., Washington, D.C. 20237. It is easily accessible by car, bus, and metro. View details »
content.html:
VOA is located at 330 Independence Avenue, S.W., Washington, D.C. 20237. It is easily accessible by car, bus, and metro.

View details »

content.markdown:
The Voice of America Studio Tour offers a firsthand look at VOA’s live news and information programming that is broadcast to an international audience in 45 languages on radio, television, and the Internet.

### Daily Tours

* Daily public tours are offered Monday through Friday at 12:00 p.m. (except Federal holidays). The doors open 10 minutes before the scheduled tour time.
* Admission: Free
* Each tour lasts 30-40 minutes.
* The tour is conducted in English only.
* Tour is recommended for children age 16 and above.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PLyTrsk1Ey8" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

### Commercial Tour Companies

To find out how to include VOA in your tour route, please email [publicrelations@voanews.com](mailto:publicrelations@voanews.com).

### Reservations

* For groups of 5 or more visitors, we ask that you please email [publicrelations@voanews.com](mailto:publicrelations@voanews.com). Groups are limited to 20 visitors.
* Reservations are recommended and can be made online.
* While walk-ins are accepted, we recommend that you call ahead or check the reservation system online, since public tours may occasionally be closed for private groups or special events being held in the building.
* When making a reservation, please indicate if a wheelchair or any other assistance is needed.

### Historic Murals

VOA’s headquarters is home to a series of historic murals commissioned by the U.S. government to depict the Social Security Act and other New Deal programs enacted in response to the Great Depression. Lithuanian-born artist Ben Shahn was selected in 1940 to paint the most prominent of the murals. Those wishing to view the murals should specify when contacting VOA to make special arrangements.

Daily Tours

VOA is located at 330 Independence Avenue, S.W., Washington, D.C. 20237. It is easily accessible by car, bus, and metro.

View details »

content.markdown:
### Where We Are

330 Independence Ave., S.W.
Washington, D.C. 20237

### Entrance

Please make sure to enter through the Independence Avenue entrance. These doors are only open for the 12:00 p.m. daily public tour.

Private tour groups are asked to come in through the C Street entrance.

### Parking

Public lots are located nearby.

### Closest Metro Stations

#### Federal Center Southwest Metro
(Blue, Orange & Silver lines)

* Exit onto 3rd Street, turn left and walk two blocks along 3rd Street to Independence Avenue.
* Turn left onto Independence.
* VOA's entrance is in the middle of the block, between 3rd and 4th Streets.

#### L'Enfant Plaza Metro

(Yellow, Green, Blue, Orange & Silver lines)

* Take the 7th Street/Maryland Ave.
* Exit and walk east to VOA's entrance on Independence Avenue, between 3rd and 4th Streets.
